technical-data.invention-title: Anordnung mit einer Gondel und einem Heizgerät
Arrangement with a nacelle and a radiator

description.p: The invention relates to an arrangement with a nacelle of a wind turbine and with a radiator, which is arranged on top of the nacelle.
The radiator is connected with the outer surface of the nacelle and is used to radiate heat, which is generated inside the nacelle to the ambient air.

The transport of wind turbine components is a challenge due to the physical dimensions of the components. Especially nacelles for an offshore site may show a length up to 12 meters or more and a diameter up to 5 meters.

For a transportation on roads it is necessary, to plan the road-connection carefully, as a transport-vehicle has to circumvent or has to cope with all barriers like curves, tunnels, bridges, traffic lights, etc.
One example is the Elbe-tunnel, which is close to Hamburg, Germany. The tunnel shows a minimum height of 4.20 m, thus a transported component and the used vehicle has to comply with this height.
In Europe a standard height of new bridges is 4.50 m, but there are many older bridges, which show a lower height of clearance.

Thus the transport vehicle and the transported component have to be constructed in a way that they comply with all of those traffic barriers or traffic restrictions along the way to a planned site for the wind turbine.
Thus the construction of wind turbine components with a high diameter is limited in a certain way.

It is well-known that a radiator is arranged on top of a wind turbine. Due to the transport limitations the radiator and the nacelle are transported separately to the planned site. At the site the radiator is placed on top of the nacelle and is connected with the nacelle.

JP 2004 285984 A discloses a wind mill which is designed to reduce costs by reduced capacity and weight of the nacelle. Even maintenance operations are reduced. The document especially refers to a pipe structure, to be used against fire in the nacelle.
It is therefore the object of the present invention to provide an improved arrangement with the nacelle and the radiator, which allows reduction of the complexity of the transport.
This object is achieved by the features of claim 1. Preferred configurations are object of the dependent claims.
According to the invention the arrangement contains a nacelle and a radiator.

The nacelle is connected with a rotational axis. The radiator is connected with the rotational axis, too. Thus the radiator can be turned around the rotational axis between a first position and a second position.

If the radiator is turned in the first position the radiator projects above the nacelle. Thus the radiator can be used in this position to transmit heat, which is generated inside the nacelle, to the environment.

If the radiator is turned in the second position the radiator does not project above the nacelle or does only project by a minimum height above the nacelle. Thus the nacelle and the radiator show as common component a certain predefined minimum height.

This allows the transport of the nacelle and the radiator as single component. The second position of the radiator allows a minimum height of the nacelle and of the radiator. Thus barriers like tunnels or bridges along the way of transport can be overcome.

Preferably the rotational axis is close to the top side of the nacelle and near to its rear side. Thus the first position of the radiator is on top of the nacelle, while the second position is close to the rear side, while the rear side is not topped by the radiator.

Thus the second position of the radiator is kept while the nacelle is transported to the side of the wind turbine, while the first position is the working-position of the radiator at the site of the wind turbine.

According to the invention the radiator can be installed and connected in a controlled production facility. It is no longer necessary to transport the nacelle and the needed radiator as separate components to the site.

Preferably the radiator and the nacelle are connected by flexible tubes, which are used to transport a cooling medium between the nacelle and the radiator. The connection between the radiator and the nacelle is closed at the production facility and maintained later.
Thus the cooling medium can be filled into the closed cooling system at the production facility and therefore in a controlled environment.

According to the invention there is no longer the need to use a crane for the installation of the radiator to the nacelle at the site. Thus personal do not longer have to climb on top of the nacelle to install and fixate the radiator in the first position.
According to the invention there is no longer the need for a separated shipment of the radiator and the nacelle to the site.

The invention is described now in more detail by help of figures. The figures show different examples and do not limit the scope of the invention.
FIG 1 shows the arrangement according to the invention,
FIG 2 shows different perspectives of the arrangement according to the invention,
FIG 3 shows different perspectives of a preferred configuration of the arrangement according to the invention,
FIG 4 shows a preferred configuration of the arrangement according to the invention, and
FIG 5 shows details of the preferred configuration in reference to FIG 3 and FIG 4.
FIG 1 shows the arrangement according to the invention.

A nacelle N1 is connected with a rotational axis RX1. A radiator RAD1 is connected with the rotational axis RX1, too. Thus the radiator RAD1 can be turned around the rotational axis RX1 between a first position POS11 and a second position POS12.

If the radiator RAD1 is turned in the first position POS11 the radiator RAD1 projects above the nacelle N1. Thus the radiator RAD1 can be used in this position POS11 to transmit heat, which is generated inside the nacelle N1, to the environment.
If the radiator RAD1 is turned in the second position POS12 the radiator RAD1 does not project above the nacelle N1 or does only project by a certain height above the nacelle N1.
Thus the nacelle N1 and the radiator RAD1 show a common certain minimum height H11.
Preferably the rotational axis RX1 is close to the top side TSN of the nacelle N and near to the rear side RSN of the nacelle N1.

Preferably the radiator RAD1 and the nacelle N1 are connected by flexible tubes TUB1, which are used to transport a cooling medium between the nacelle N1 and the radiator RAD1. This flexible connection TUB1 between the radiator RAD1 and the nacelle N1 is already joined at the production facility and thus is kept for the transportation.
FIG 2A to FIG 2D show different perspectives of the arrangement in reference to FIG 1.
In reference to FIG 1 these figures show the radiator schematically without housing.
FIG 2A and FIG 2B show the radiator RAD1 and the nacelle N1, while the radiator RAD1 is brought to the first position POS11. This is the "work-position" of the radiator RAD1.

To move the radiator RAD1 in its upright position POS11 an electrical motor M1 is used, which is acting on a spindle S1. It is also possible to use other arrangements for this movement - for example pneumatic-systems or hydraulic-systems.

FIG 2C and FIG 2D show the radiator RAD1 and the nacelle N1, while the radiator RAD1 is brought to the second position POS12. This is the transport-position of the radiator RAD1, while the radiator RAD1 is connected with the nacelle N1 to form a single component.

The position POS12 can also be used for service tasks. Preferably the rear side RSN of the nacelle N1 contains an opening for this purpose. This allows service-actions by personal without leaving the nacelle N1.
To move the radiator RAD1 in this position POS12 the electrical motor M1 is used, which is acting on the spindle S1 as described above.
Thus the nacelle N1 and the radiator RAD1 show the common certain minimum height H11 during the transport.
FIG 3A to FIG 3D show different perspectives of a preferred configuration of the arrangement according to the invention.
This configuration shows a radiator RAD3, which is formed like a channel. Thus the heat of the nacelle N3 is transferred easily to the environment by the use of huge areas of the radiator R3.
FIG 3A and FIG 3B show the radiator RAD3 and the nacelle N3, while the radiator RAD3 is brought to the first position POS31. This is the "work-position" of the radiator RAD3.

To move the radiator RAD3 in its upright position POS 31 an electrical motor M3 is used, which is acting on a spindle S3. It is also possible to use other arrangements for this movement - for example pneumatic-systems or hydraulic-systems.

FIG 3C and FIG 3D show the radiator RAD3 and the nacelle N3, while the radiator RAD3 is brought to the second position POS32. This is the transport-position of the radiator RAD3, while the radiator RAD3 is connected with the nacelle N3 to form a single component.
To move the radiator RAD3 in this position POS32 the electrical motor M3 is used, which is acting on the spindle S3 as described above.
Thus the nacelle N3 and the radiator RAD3 show the common certain minimum height H31 during the transport.
FIG 4 shows a preferred configuration of the arrangement according to the invention.

A nacelle N4 is connected with a first rotational axis RX41. A radiator RAD4 is connected with the first rotational axis RX41, too. Thus the radiator RAD4 can be turned around the first rotational axis RX41 between a first position POS41 and a second position POS42.

If the radiator RAD4 is turned in the first position POS41 the radiator RAD4 projects above the nacelle N4. Thus the radiator RAD4 can be used in this position POS41 to transmit heat, which is generated inside the nacelle N4, to the environment.
If the radiator RAD4 is turned in the second position POS42 the radiator RAD4 does not project above the nacelle N4 or does only project by a certain height above the nacelle N4.
Thus the nacelle N4 and the radiator RAD4 show a common certain minimum height H41.
Preferably the first rotational axis RX41 is close to the top side TSN of the nacelle N and near to its rear side RSN.
A bar B is used to carry instruments INS, which are used to measure the wind speed or other environmental parameters, for example.
The bar B is connected to a second rotational axis RX42. The second rotational axis RX42 is an integrated part of the radiator RAD4.
The bar B can be turned around the second rotational axis RX42 between a first position POS51 and a second position POS52.

If the bar B is turned to the first position POS51 the bar B projects together with the radiator RAD4 above the nacelle N4. Thus the bar B can be used in this position POS51 to measure the environmental parameters.

If the bar B is turned to the second position POS52 the bar B is close to the top side TSN of the nacelle N. Thus the instruments INS can be adjusted from inside the nacelle N4 via an opening OP in the nacelle N. Thus there is no need for personnel to leave the nacelle N4 for the maintenance or service of the instruments INS.

As the second rotational axis RX42 is an integrated part of the radiator RAD4, the radiator RAD4 and the bar B can be turned around the first rotational axis RX41 as single component and into the transport position POS42.
FIG 5 shows details of the preferred configuration in reference to FIG 4. To turn the bar B a motor M4 is used. The motor M4 may be an integrated part of the radiator RAD4.

claim.claim-text: Anordnung mit einer Gondel und einem Kühler einer Windenergieanlage, - wobei die Gondel (N1, N3, N4) drehbar mit dem Kühler (RAD1, RAD3, RAD4) verbunden ist, um mit der Gondel eine gemeinsame Komponente der Windenergieanlage zu bilden, - wobei die Verbindung auf eine solche Weise konstruiert und angeordnet ist, dass der Kühler zwischen einer ersten Position (POS11, POS31, POS41) und einer zweiten Position (POS12, POS32, POS42) schwenken kann, - wobei der Kühler, wenn er in der ersten Position verriegelt ist, oberhalb der Gondel vorsteht, um Wärme aus der Gondel an die Umgebung abzuleiten, - wobei der Kühler, wenn er in der zweiten Position verriegelt ist, sich nahe der Hinterseite (RSN) der Gondel befindet, um eine minimale Höhe der gemeinsamen Komponente zu erreichen, damit Hindernisse entlang eines Transportweges der Gondel zu einem geplanten Standort überwunden werden, und - wobei die Hinterseite der Gondel eine Öffnung enthält, um Wartungsmaßnahmen durch Personal an dem Kühler ohne Verlassen der Gondel zu ermöglichen.
Anordnung nach Anspruch 1, wobei die Gondel mit einer Drehachse (RX1, RX41) verbunden ist und wobei der Kühler mit der Drehachse verbunden ist.
Anordnung nach Anspruch 2, wobei die Drehachse in der Nähe einer Oberseite (TSN) der Gondel und/oder in der Nähe einer Hinterseite (RSN) der Gondel angeordnet ist.

Anordnung nach Anspruch 1, wobei der Kühler und die Gondel durch Schläuche (TUB1) verbunden sind, welche verwendet werden, um ein Kühlmedium zwischen der Gondel und dem Kühler für die Wärmeübertragung zu transportieren.

Anordnung nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 4, wobei ein Elektromotorsystem (M1) oder ein Pneumatiksystem oder ein Hydrauliksystem mit dem Kühler und/oder der Gondel verbunden ist, um die Position zu ändern.

Anordnung nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 5, - wobei der Kühler mit einer zweiten Drehachse (RX42) verbunden ist, - wobei eine Stange (B) ebenfalls mit der zweiten Drehachse verbunden ist, um eine gemeinsame Komponente zu bilden, - wobei die Stange derart konstruiert ist, dass sie Instrumente (INS) trägt, welche verwendet werden, um Umgebungsparameter zu messen, - wobei die Stange mit der zweiten Drehachse derart verbunden ist, dass die Stange zwischen einer ersten Position (POS51) und einer zweiten Position (POS52) schwenken kann, - wobei die Stange in der ersten Stangenposition zusammen mit dem Kühler oberhalb der Gondel vorsteht, während die Instrumente verwendet werden, um die Umgebungsparameter zu messen, - wobei sich die Stange in der zweiten Stangenposition in der Nähe der Oberseite der Gondel befindet, während die Instrumente der Stange vom Inneren der Gondel aus über Gondelöffnungen eingestellt und gewartet werden.
Anordnung nach Anspruch 6, wobei die zweite Drehachse ein integraler Bestandteil des Kühlers ist.

Arrangement with a nacelle and a radiator of a wind
turbine, - where the nacelle (N1, N3, N4) is rotatabley connected with the radiator (RAD1, RAD3, RAD4), to build with the nacelle a joint component of the wind turbine, - where the connection is constructed and arranged in a way, that the radiator is allowed to pivot between a first position (POS11, POS31, POS41) and a second position (POS12, POS32, POS42), - where the radiator when locked in the first position projects above the nacelle to remove heat from the nacelle to the environment, - where the radiator when locked in the second position is close to the rear side (RSN) of the nacelle to achieve a minimum height of the joint component thus barriers along a way of transport of the nacelle to a planned site are overcome, and - wherein the rear side of the nacelle contains an opening
to allow service actions by personnel at the radiator without leaving the nacelle.
Arrangement according to claim 1, where the nacelle is connected with a rotational axis (RX1, RX41) and where the radiator is connected with the rotational axis.
Arrangement according to claim 2, where the rotational axis is arranged close to a top side (TSN) of the nacelle and/or near to a rear side (RSN) of the nacelle.

Arrangement according to claim 1, where the radiator and the nacelle are connected by flexible tube, (TUB1), which are used to transport a cooling medium between the nacelle and the radiator for the transfer of heat.

Arrangement according to one of the claims 1 to 4, where a electrical motor-system (M1) or a pneumatic-system or a hydraulic-system is connected with the radiator and/or the nacelle to change the position.

Arrangement according to one of the claims 1 to 5, - where the radiator is connected with a second rotational
axis (RX42), - where a bar (B) is also connected with the second rotational axis to build a joint component, - where the bar is constructed in a way, that it supports instruments (INS), which are used to measure environment-parameters, - where the bar is connected with the second rotational axis in a way, that the bar is allowed to pivot between a first position (POS51) and a second position (POS52), - where the bar projects together with the radiator above the nacelle in the first bar-position, while the instruments are used to measure the environmental parameters, - where the bar is close to the top side of the nacelle in the second bar-position, while the instruments of the bar are adjusted and maintained from inside the nacelle via nacelle-openings.
Arrangement according to claim 6, where the second rotational axis is an integrated part of the radiator.

Agencement avec une nacelle et un radiateur d'une éolienne, - où la nacelle (N1, N3, N4) est connectée de façon rotative avec le radiateur (RAD1, RAD3, RAD4), pour constituer avec la nacelle un composant joint de l'éolienne, - où la connexion est construite et agencée de telle manière que le radiateur est laissé pivoter entre une première position (POS11, POS31, POS41) et une deuxième position (POS12, POS32, POS42), - où le radiateur, lorsqu'il est bloqué dans la première position, se projette au-dessus de la nacelle pour transférer une chaleur de la nacelle jusque dans l'environnement, - où le radiateur, lorsqu'il est bloqué dans la deuxième position, est à proximité du côté arrière (RSN) de la nacelle pour obtenir une hauteur minimum du composant joint, de sorte que des obstacles sur un chemin de transport de la nacelle jusqu'à un site planifié sont surmontés, et - dans lequel le côté arrière de la nacelle contient une ouverture pour permettre des actions d'entretien par des personnels au niveau du radiateur sans quitter la nacelle.
Agencement selon la revendication 1, où la nacelle est connectée avec un axe de rotation (RX1, RX41) et où le radiateur est connecté avec l'axe de rotation.
Agencement selon la revendication 2, où l'axe de rotation est agencé à proximité d'un côté supérieur (TSN) de la nacelle et/ou à côté d'un côté arrière (RSN) de la nacelle.

Agencement selon la revendication 1, où le radiateur et la nacelle sont connectés par des tubes flexibles (TUB1), qui sont utilisés pour transporter un agent de refroidissement entre la nacelle et le radiateur pour le transfert de chaleur.

Agencement selon l'une des revendications 1 à 4, où un système de moteur électrique (M1) ou un système pneumatique ou un système hydraulique est connecté avec le radiateur et/ou la nacelle pour changer la position.

Agencement selon l'une des revendications 1 à 5, - où le radiateur est connecté avec un deuxième axe de rotation (RX42), - où une barre (B) est également connectée avec le deuxième axe de rotation pour constituer un composant joint, - où la barre est construite de telle manière qu'elle supporte des instruments (INS) qui sont utilisés pour mesurer des paramètres environnementaux, - où la barre est connectée avec le deuxième axe de rotation de telle manière que la barre est laissée pivoter entre une première position (POS51) et une deuxième position (POS52), - où la barre se projette avec le radiateur au-dessus de la nacelle dans la première position de barre, tandis que les instruments sont utilisés pour mesurer les paramètres environnementaux, - où la barre est à proximité du côté supérieur de la nacelle dans la deuxième position de barre, tandis que les instruments de la barre sont ajustés et entretenus de l'intérieur de la nacelle par l'intermédiaire d'ouvertures de nacelle.
Agencement selon la revendication 6, où le deuxième axe de rotation est une partie intégrée du radiateur.
